'''up2date''', also known as the '''Red Hat Update Agent''', is a tool used by older versions of [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]], [[CentOS]] and [[Fedora Core]] that downloads and installs new software and upgrades the operating system. +
'''up2date''', also known as the '''Red Hat Update Agent''', is a tool used by older versions of [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]], [[CentOS]] and [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora Core]] that downloads and installs new software and upgrades the operating system. It functions as a front-end to the [[RPM Package Manager]] and adds advanced features such as automatic dependency resolution. The file <tt>/etc/sysconfig/rhn/sources</tt> specifies where up2date will search for packages.
By default, [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]]'s up2date retrieves packages from a [[Red Hat Network]] (RHN) server, though users can add directories full of packages or even [[Debian]] and [[Yellow dog Updater, Modified|yum]] repositories if they wish.
By default, [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]]'s up2date retrieves packages from a [[Red Hat Network]] (RHN) server, though users can add directories full of packages or even [[Debian]] and [[Yellow dog Updater, Modified|yum]] repositories if they wish.
